The livelihood of the ferry was some what quelled by the building of the Bursledon toll bridge in 1798.The original wooden bridge has now been replaced ,(around 1933-35) and a newer motorway bridge was built for the M27 further up the river. Just after the first world war the price of the ferry went up from 1d a trip to 3d a trip.Now the ferryman ,Ray Sedgewick charges 20p for adults ,10p for children under twelve and 5p for cycles.The ferry runs from 6.30am to 7pm on weekdays,8.00 to 5.30pm on saturdays,and 9.00am to 5.00pm on Sundays, every day apart from Christmas day and Boxing day.
At high tide the width of the crossing is a quarter of a mile and only an eighth of a mile at low water.
